channel.title: Dividing the Help section up?
channel.description:
I think it would be a good idea if we break the help section into multiple sub-sections. Make them child boards, or something (not different sections)Such as.
• Deltascape • Bulby • Devo 2.7 • Battlescape • 508+ • Maybe 474 • Common help, compiling errors.
And you may have a comeback like: We won't do this, because people use the search bar for everything. But my answer to this is when you search for [b]anything[/b] you get spammed out of help threads that are never answered, no matter how much you narrow the search down to. Help section needs to be cleaned out.
Discuss? Flame, spam, hate welcomed ;D

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

I laughed at bulbyscape, deltascape and Battlescape. No single server is that important to have it’s own sub-section here.

What is your reasoning behind making sub-sections? It’s not difficult to decipher one problem from another, so I don’t think an indication is even necessary. As many have said before, java is java,. There’s no difference from one server to another.

Read full topic

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @T3arful T3arful
item.description:
@T3arful wrote:

They don’t need to be divided up, Java is java. Doesn’t really matter what server ‘base’ it is, it will all be similar anyway.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Newty:

All of them server’s are programmed in Java… Why have a different help section for each one?

Because, if you want to help someone, they don’t post there base, and they don’t post if its a 317. So you have to take time to get there base, ect. Its annoying.

But as someone said, you’d be smart not to ask help from moparscape help section.

Read full topic

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @skepskep skepskep
item.description:
@skepskep wrote:

[quote=“Primadude, post:10, topic:334143”][quote author=skepskep link=topic=430529.msg3161181#msg3161181 date=1269557524]

read javadocs then

Javadocs don’t tell you that the speed of an ArrayList is O(n) while the speed of a HashSet is O(1) nor do they tell you how to generate good hash codes.

They also don’t tell you ‘what networking should i use for mai server’ or ‘how can I best go about player updating’, etc.
[/quote]

Apache mina is decent: http://mina.apache.org/
Read up on the Runescape protocol for information about updating etc: http://runewiki.moparisthebest.com/[/quote]

Umm those were rhetorical, and I’d prefer grizzly/netty, and for updating using an EnumSet and if/else statements.

Also you should back up your ideas. Why should I use MINA???

I know I use grizzly because when benchmarked it was faster than MINA, and for updating EnumSets are quick (and if/else statements with the EnumSets are faster than switch(enum))

Read full topic

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote=“skepskep, post:9, topic:334143”][quote author=Kihomura link=topic=430529.msg3161176#msg3161176 date=1269557301]
read javadocs then
[/quote]

Javadocs don’t tell you that the speed of an ArrayList is O(n) while the speed of a HashSet is O(1) nor do they tell you how to generate good hash codes.

They also don’t tell you ‘what networking should i use for mai server’ or ‘how can I best go about player updating’, etc.[/quote]

Apache mina is decent: http://mina.apache.org/
Read up on the Runescape protocol for information about updating etc: http://runewiki.moparisthebest.com/

Read full topic

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

What’s the point in having separate boards for:

  1. Separate servers.
  2. Servers that are a pile of shit.
  3. Server revisions that don’t even have decent bases to use (Although you can convert Hyperion to any revision easily).

Read full topic

item.title: Dividing the Help section up?
item.dc:creator: @skepskep skepskep
item.description:
@skepskep wrote:

I think more appropriate sections should be:

[ul][li]Beginners[/li]
[li]Non-retards[/li][/ul]

I actually enjoy helping people, but I can’t stand to answer a question that I think is stupid… Which is pretty much every post in the Help section (some people ask HALF decent questions SOMETIMES although I haven’t seen it yet I know they’re out there, being flooded by questions from 10 year olds).

Read full topic
